sen.j: 上海上国造（かみつうなかみのくにみやつこ・かみつうなかみこくぞう)は上総国中部を支配した国造。
sen.e: Kamitsuunakaminokunimiyatsuko 上海上国造 (also known as Kamitsuunakamikokuzo) was kuninomiyatsuko ruled the central part of Kazusa Province.
Kamitsuunakami no kunimiyatsuko 上海上国造 (also known as Kamitsuunakamikokuzo) was kuninomiyatsuko (local ruling families in ancient Japan) ruled the central part of Kazusa Province.
sen.cmt: local ruling families in ancient Japan を追加しました。
sen.e: Kamitsuunakami no kunimiyatsuko 上海上国造 (also known as Kamitsuunakamikokuzo) was kuninomiyatsuko (local ruling families in ancient Japan) ruled the central part of Kazusa Province.
It is also written as 上菟上国造.
It is also written as 上菟上国造.
It is also written as 上菟上国造.
According to "Kojiki", the ancestor was Takehiyodorinomikoto.
According to "Kojiki" (Records of Ancient Matters), the ancestor was Takehiyodori no Mikoto.
sen.cmt: Records of Ancient Matters を追加表記を変更しました。
sen.e: According to "Kojiki" (Records of Ancient Matters), the ancestor was Takehiyodori no Mikoto.

sen.j: 別名は武夷鳥命・天夷鳥命・天日照命など。
sen.e: Pseudonyms were Takehiyodorinomikoto, Amenohinadorinomikoto, Amenohinaderinomikoto, and the like.
Pseudonyms were Takehinadori no Mikoto, Amenohinatori no Mikoto, Amenohinaderi no Mikoto, and the like.
Pseudonyms were Takehinadori no Mikoto, Amenohinatori no Mikoto, Amenohinaderi no Mikoto, and the like.
He was a son of Amenohohinokami.
He was a son of Amenohohi no kami.
He was a son of Amenohohi no kami.

sen.j: 『国造本紀』その7世孫忍立化多比が成務天皇朝に上海上国造になり、その孫久都伎直が応神天皇朝に下海上国造になったという。
sen.e: According to "Kuninomiyatsuko hongi", Oshitatutakehi, the 7th descendant from Takehiyodorinomikoto, became Kamitsuunakaminokunimiyatsuko during the reign of Emperor Seimu, and a grandson of Oshitatutakehi became Shimotsuunakaminokunimiyatsuko during the reign of Emperor Onin.

According to "Kokuzo hongi" (the original record of provincial governors), Oshitateketahi, the 7th descendant from Takehiyodori no Mikoto, became Kamitsuunakami no kunimiyatsuko during the reign of Emperor Seimu, and a grandson of Oshitatutakehi became Shimotsuunakami no kunimiyatsuko during the reign of Emperor Onin.
sen.cmt: the original record of provincial governorsを追加しました。Kuninomiyatsuko hongi→Kokuzo hongi (the original record of provincial governors)Oshitatutakehi→Oshitateketahi
sen.e: According to "Kokuzo hongi" (the original record of provincial governors), Oshitateketahi, the 7th descendant from Takehiyodori no Mikoto, became Kamitsuunakami no kunimiyatsuko during the reign of Emperor Seimu, and a grandson of Oshitatutakehi became Shimotsuunakami no kunimiyatsuko during the reign of Emperor Onin.

sen.j: 出雲氏......出雲国造・武蔵国造・下海上国造・伊甚国造・遠淡海国造などと同系。
sen.e: The Izumo clan: It was descended from the same line as Izumonokuninomiyatsuko, Musashinokuninomiyatsuko, Shimotsuunakamikuninomiyatsuko, Ijimunokuninomiyatsuko, Tootsuominokuninomiyatsuko, and the like.

The Izumo clan: It was descended from the same line as Izumo no kuninomiyatsuko, Musashi no kuninomiyatsuko, Shimotsuunakami kuninomiyatsuko, Ijimu no kuninomiyatsuko, Tootsuomi no kuninomiyatsuko, and the like.

sen.j: 天武天皇11年(682年)に連、14年(685)に忌寸に昇格。
sen.e: In 682, the clan was promoted to Muraji, and in 685, promoted to Imiki.

sen.j: 姉崎古墳群は一族の墓と推定される。
sen.e: It is supposed that the Anesaki Kofun mounds are burial site of the clan.

sen.j: 現在の千葉県市原市の一部。

sen.j: 檜前舎人建麻呂 ...... 奈良時代の官人。
